intro: Anemone ochotensis, commonly known as the Siberian anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and the Far East. It features showy, white to pinkish flowers with numerous petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has a short, stout rhizome and basal leaves that are palmately lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along riverbanks. Anemone ochotensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler regions.
